function.description: Inside IF we will use AND condition. performs a logical conjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will 'drag column'. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,like). In 'value' parameter provide condition value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' condition , 'AND' conditions. Example: CASE WHEN 'Washington' like '%sh%' AND 'Washington' like 'W%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched' end

Inside case we will use when condition. Evaluates each condition from left to right and returns the result when the first condition met. If no condition met return from else if exist, otherwise return null. Example : CASE WHEN Quantity > 30 THEN "The quantity is greater than 30" ELSE "The quantity is under 30" END
Returns from statement_list when condition gets fail.We will use ELSE inside case function. Example: CASE when 50 > 0 then 'true' else 'false'

function.signature: (case when ${column} ${condition} ${value} then ${conditiontrue} when ${elseIfcolumn} ${elseIfcondition} ${elseIfvalue} then ${elseIfconditiontrue} else ${conditionfalse} ${moreconditions} end)
function.description: Evaluates conditions and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. We will use nested condition inside else 'conditiontrue' parameter. Example:case when creditlim > 50000 then 'PLATINUM' else when (creditlim > = 50000) then 'GOLD' else 'SILVER' end

Inside IF we will use AND, OR conditions. Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR', 'AND' conditions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 (Note : In such case don't provide anything in 'condition' parameter and 'value' parameter). Example : (Case when (creditlim > 50000) then 'PLATINUM' else 'SILVER' end)
Returns Expr1 if it is not null otherwise return expr2. Example : IFNULL(profit, '0')
Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. Example : case when 'washington'like 'W%' then 'true' else 'false' end

Inside WHEN condition we will use ISNULL. Evalutes and returns 'Conditiontrue' if the expression contain Null. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 ISNULL THEN Conditionfalse. Example2 : CASE WHEN NULL ISNULL THEN Conditiontrue

Performs a logical disjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' , 'AND' functions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 in such case don't provide anything in 'condition' and 'value' parameter. We will use OR inside IF. Example : CASE WHEN 'Washington' like '%sh%' OR 'Washington' like 'W%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched' end

Returns 'statement_list' when condition get satisfied . In column paramter we will drag column. In searchcondition parameter provide conditions like (>, =, IS Null etc .,). In value parameter provide value(Note : IS Null used in 'condition' parameter then don't provide anything in 'value' parameter). In moreconditions parameter we will use nested when conditions, Else condition . We will use WHEN inside CASE. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 > 0 THEN 'one' else 'TWO'. Example2 : CASE WHEN 'Singapore' IS NULL THEN 'Singa' ELSE 'pore'. Example3 : CASE WHEN Washington like '%sh%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched'

function.signature: (CASE WHEN ${expr} IS NULL THEN '0' ELSE ${expr} end)
function.description: Returns "expression" if it is not null, otherwise returns zero.Example :ZN(null) result :0
It returns the absolute value of a number. Example: abs(-24)Result: 24
Returns the arc cosine of number. Example: acos(0.25) result: 1.318116071652818
Returns the arc sine of number. Example: asin(0.25) result: 0.25268025514207865
Returns the arc tangent of number. Example: atan(0.25) result: 0.24497866312686414
Returns the arc tangent of given number. Example: atan2(0.50,1) result: 0.4636476090008061
Returns number rounded up to the nearest integer. Example: ceiling(0.25) result: 1
Returns the cosine of number. Example: cos(0.25) result: 0.9689124217106447
Returns the cotangent of an angle. Specify the angle in radians. Example: cot(0.25) result: 3.9163173646459399
Converts angle number in radians to degrees. Example: degrees(0.25) result: 14.32394487827058
Returns the integer part of a division operation. Example: div(5,10) result: 2
Returns Euler’s number raised to the power of the given number. Example: exp(2) result: 7.389
Returns number rounded down to the nearest number. Example: floor(3.1415) result: 3
Returns the natural logarithm of number. Example: ln(2) result: 0.6931471805599453
Returns the base 10 logarithm of number. Example: log(2) result: 0.3010299956639812
Returns the largest of the provided values. Example: greatest(4,13) result: 13
Returns the smallest of the provided values. Example: least(13,4) result: 4
Displays the value of a number raised to the power of another number. Example: power(4,2) result: 16
Converts the value of a number from degrees to radians. Example : radians(4) result : 0.06981317007977318
Displays a value rounded to a certain number of decimal places. Example: round(34.4158,2) result: 34.42
Returns the signum function of number, that is: 0 if the argument is 0, 1 if the argument is greater than 0, -1 if the argument is less than 0. Example: sign(0.5) result: 1.
Returns the sine of number. Example: sin(0.25) result: 0.24740395925452294
Displays the square root of a non-negative number. Example: sqrt(5) result: 2.23606797749979
It displays the square of a given number. Example: square(4) result: 16
Returns the tangent of number. Example: tan(0.25) result: 0.25534192122103627
Returns the constant Pi. Example: pi() result: 3.14159
Displays a number truncated to a certain number of decimal places. Example: truncate(1.289,2) result: 1.28
Returns the Unicode of the first character of string. Example : ASCII('A') result: 65
Returns the character encoded by the ASCII code. Example: CHAR(65) result: A
Returns the concatenation of string1, string2. Example:concat('Beng','aluru') result: Bengaluru
Returns true if the given string contains the specified substring. Example: case when(locate('g', 'Bengaluru'))>0 then true else false end result: true

function.signature: case when(${string} like ('%'||${substring})) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if the given string endswith specified substring. Example:case when('postgres' like ('%'||'res')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.

Returns the starting position of the first instance of substring in string. Positions start with 1. If not found, 0 is returned. Example :locate('z','Bengaluru') result : 0, locate('aluru','Bengaluru') result : 5
Returns the position of nth occurrence of given substring in a string. Example:instr('calculation','a',1, 2).Result:7
Returns the left most (length) character from the string . Example: left('Bengaluru',4) result: beng
Returns the number of characters in text. Example: length('Bengaluru') result:9
Converts all characters in the specified string to lowercase. Example: LOWER('BENGALURU') result: bengaluru

Displays a string that is left padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than string, return value is truncated to length characters. Example: LPAD('Wellesley', 14,'Hills') result:HillsWellesley.

Displays a string that is right-padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than the length of string, the result is truncated to length characters. Length must not be negative and padString must not be non-empty. Example: Rpad('Wellesley', 15, 'Hills') result: Wellesley Hills
Returns string with the characters in reverse order. Example : REVERSE('Bengaluru') result :urulagneB
Removes leading whitespace from string Example: LTRIM(' Bengaluru') result: Bengaluru
Returns the text starting from specified position. If position is more than string or length is less than 1 it will return empty string. Example: substr('bengaluru',2,5) result: engal
String search for substring and replace it with replacestring. If substring is not found, the string is not changed. Example: REPLACE('bengaluru','b','Z') result: Zengaluru
Returns the rightmost character from the string. Example : right('bengaluru',4) result :urul
Removes trailing whitespace from string. Example: RTRIM('Bengaluru ') Result: Bengaluru
Returns a string consisting of space characters. Example:space(6) -" "

Splits string on delimiter and returns the field index. Field indexes start with 1. If the index is larger than the number of fields, then null is returned. Example : split_part(‘a-b-c-d’, ‘-‘, 2) result: b, split_part(‘a|b|c|d’, ‘|‘, 2) result : b

function.signature: case when(${string} like (${substring}||'%')) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if string starts with substring. Example: case when('bengaluru' like ('ben'||'%')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.
Removes whitespace from string. Example:TRIM(' Bengaluru ') result: Bengaluru
Converts all characters in a string to uppercase. Example: UPPER('bengaluru') result: BENGALURU
to_char function converts a number to a string.
Convert the first letter of each word to uppercase and the rest to lowercase. Words are sequences of alphanumeric characters separated by non-alphanumeric characters.

Returns the specified date with the specified number of interval added to the specified date_part of that date.Example:(date '2014-03-08' + Interval '2' year) result:2016-03-08 supported units:day, month , year.

Returns the difference between date1 and date2 expressed in terms of unit. Example:(EXTRACT(year from date '2019-03-08')-EXTRACT(year from date '2014-03-08')) result: 4 supported units: day, month , year.
Returns an integer that represents the specified unit of the specified date. Example: extract(year FROM '2014-03-08') result: 2014. supported unit:YEAR,MONTH,DAY
Truncates the specified date to the accuracy specified by the unit. Example:date_trunc('year',DATE '2014-03-08') result: 2014-01-01

function.signature: case when length(${year}) <> 0 OR length(${month}) <> 0 OR length(${day}) <> 0 then cast(concat(${year},'-',${month},'-',${day}) AS date ) else null end
function.description: Returns a date for given year, month and day. Example: MAKEDATE('2019','07','23') result : 2013-07-15
Displays Current date.

Returns the specified date with the specified number of interval added to the specified date_part of that date.Example:(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:07:20' + 2 year) result:2016-03-08 09:07:20 supported units:hour,minute,second,day , month , year.

Returns the difference between datetime and datetime2 expressed in terms of unit. Example:EXTRACT(year from timestamp '2019-03-08 10:12:12')-EXTRACT(year from timestamp '2011-03-08 10:12:12') result: 8 supported units: second, minute , hour , day , month , year.

Returns an integer that represents the specified datepart of the specified date. Example: DATE_PART('year', timestamp('2014-03-08 12:11:20')) result: 2014. supported date_part:YEAR, QUARTER, MONTH , DAY.
The DAY function returns the day part of a value. Example: day(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00') result : 8 NOTE:column's value should be in single quotes if you are typing the value.
Retruns the name of the week day for date/dateTime. Example: dayname(timestamp '2007-02-03 09:00:00')/dayname(date '2007-02-03') result: 'Saturday'
Returns the ISO day of the week for date/datetime. The value ranges from 1 (SUNDAY) to 7 (SATURDAY). Example: cast(TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:00:00','D')as int) result: 7

Return a TIMESTAMP format as a string.Example: TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY/MM/DD HH24:MI:SS') result:2019/07/20 09:10:20. Example2 : TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY') result:2019. Example3 : TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY-MM') result:2019-07.

function.signature: (case when length(${year}) <> 0 OR length(${month}) <> 0 OR length(${day}) <> 0 OR length(${hour}) <> 0 OR length(${minute}) <> 0 OR length(${second}) <> 0 then CAST(concat(${year},'-', ${month},'-',${day},' ', ${hour},':', ${minute},':', ${second}) AS timestamp) else null end)
function.description: Returns a datetime that combines year,month,day,hour,minute,second and time. Example: MAKEDATETIME(date '1899-12-30', '07:59:00')result:2019-07-29 09:20:20.000000.

function.signature: (case when length(${hour}) <> 0 OR length(${minute}) <> 0 OR length(${second}) <> 0 then CAST(concat('09',':', '20',':', '20') as time)else null end)
function.description: Returns time value from the hour, minute and seconds.Example: maketime('12','15','30') result:12:15:30
Returns HOUR from datetime.Example: hour(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19') result: 12
Returns minute for date/datetime. Example: minute('2014-03-08 12:20:19') result: 20.
Returns the ISO week of the year for date/dateTime. The value ranges from 0 to 52. Example: week(timestamp '2014-03-08 22:20:19')/week(date '2014-03-08') result: 9

function.signature:
(CASE WHEN ((${dateTime} - (000101 (DATE))) + 1) MOD 7 = 6 THEN ${dateTime} + 6
ELSE ${dateTime} + (6 - (((${dateTime} - (000101 (DATE))) + 1) MOD 7 + 1)) END)
function.description: Returns nearest weekday of the provided date.Note: Please make sure the column is date type only while using.
Returns the month of the year for date/datetime. Example: month(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19')/month(date '2014-03-08') result:2
Returns MONTHNAME from date/datetime.Example: monthname(timestamp '2007-02-03 09:00:00')/ monthname(date '2007-02-03') result: 'February'
Displays Current date and time.
Takes a string as input and displays a timestamp. Example.to_timestamp('2014-03-08 09:00:00','YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS') result:2014-03-08 09:00:00.000000
Returns the quarter of the year for date/datetime. Example: quarter(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:20:19') result:1
Returns SECONDS for date/datetime.Example: second(timestamp '2019-07-20 09:10:20') result: 20
Returns the year for date/datetime. Example: year(timestamp '2007-02-03 09:00:00') result: 2007

Cast function converts one dataType to another datatype. Note:All Values should be in single quotes if user provide's value.Example: CAST('2019-03-22 17:34:03.000' AS varchar(23)) result:2019-03-22 17:34:03.000
Converts value to char type. NOTE:field should be in single quotes if you are typing manually.Example1:char(date '2019-11-22')result:2019-11-22 Example2:char(12345) result:'12345'
This function is used to convert character based date value to date type.(format is not required)Example:CAST('2018-08-30' as DATE) result:2018-08-30
This function is used to convert character based dateTime value to dateTime type.(format is not required)Example:CAST('2018-08-30 10:15:30' as TIMESTAMP) result:2018-08-30 10:15:30
Converts the value to decimal type. Example: cast(23.3 as decimal) result: 23
This function is used to convert character based integer value to integer type.(format is not required) Example:cast('456' as integer) result:456
This function is used to convert character based time value to time type.(format is not required) Example:CAST('10:15:30' as TIME) result:10:15:30
Converts the date to string
Converts the number to string
Converts the datetime to string
Converts the time to string
Converts the other to string
